As the Chief Technology Officer, I would like to share the architecture of the new AI-enabled mobile operating system with all the layers starting from the Kernel layer to the Android apps layer, and the updates and additions that we will be making to include our product vision and features.

1. Kernel Layer: Our new AI-enabled mobile operating system will be based on the Linux kernel, which will provide a solid foundation and stability. We will be using the latest stable version of the Linux kernel, and will make updates and customizations as necessary to support our new features and capabilities.
2. Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL): We will be using the Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) provided by AOSP to abstract the hardware-specific details of the device, and to provide a common interface for the rest of the software layers.
3. Libraries and Runtime: We will be using the standard libraries and runtime provided by AOSP such as Bionic, libc, and the Dalvik/ART runtime. We will also be incorporating additional libraries and runtime components to support our new features such as edge-AI and federated learning.
4. Framework Layer: We will be using the framework layer provided by AOSP to provide a common set of services and APIs for the apps layer. We will be making updates and additions to the framework layer to support our new features and capabilities such as Homomorphic Encryption, Differential Privacy, and blockchain.
5. Application Framework: We will be using the application framework provided by AOSP to provide a set of high-level services and APIs for the apps layer. We will be making updates and additions to the application framework to support our new features and capabilities such as AI and ML APIs and SDKs.
